task.title: Viewing the history of branches and files
task.shortdesc: At some point in the development cycle, you may want to see exactly when and by whom specific changes were introduced. You can see the history of the current branch or a modified file listed in the staging area.

step.cmd: Perform one of the following actions:

choices.choice: View the history of the current branch by clicking the Show current branch history icon in the toolbar. Show current branch history
View the history of a specific file by right-clicking a file in the staging area and selecting Show history.
View the history of a specific file with per-author color-coded higlighting by right-clicking a file in the staging area and selecting Show blame.

step.cmd: If you are viewing the history of the current branch, in the commited changes panel of the Git History view, right-click a file and choose one of the following options:

chrow.chdesc: Displays a comparison between the version in the selected commit and the previously committed version.
Displays a comparison between the version in the selected commit and the version in your working copy.
